body:
Replacing that with zero just to get deterministic output is a poor move. Deterministic output is nice, but the first goal of `archive/tar` is to make valid tar archives, not to be useful as an input to some other system that wants deterministic input.

It *does* seem reasonable to provide a way to override that default, though. A new field in the `tar.Header` type to override it would be a better move.
